columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to analyze the situation and determine if which country would the treasurer want to invest the company’s funds.

The exercise mentioned that the treasurer wanted to invest $30 million for three months in Great Britain. The following are required in the exercise:

<center>

| | Great Britain| 
|--|:--:| 
|interest rate | 0.31% per month| 
|spot exchange rate| £ 0.791|
|three-month forward rate|£ 0.803|

 
The interest rate of U.S. is 0.28% per month.

A **forward trade** is an agreement to *exchange currency in the future*. The *exchange rate in the agreement* of a forward trade is called a **forward exchange rate.**
\
The **spot rate** is the *exchange rate in a spot trade*. The **spot trade** is an agreement to exchange currencies based on the exchange rate on that date and must be settled within two business days.

First, we need to determine how much will the treasurer get if he invest in the U.S. To get it, we need to get the future value of the investment after three months. The computation is as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Investment in 3 months} &= \text{Investment}\times{\text{FV of Interest }}\\
&= \text{\$ 30,000,000}\times{\text{$0.28\%^{\text{3 months}}$}}\\
&= \text{\$ 30,000,000}\times{\text{1.0084}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{\$ 30,252,000}}\\
\end{aligned}$$
The investment is worth **$ 30,252,000** if the treasurer will invest in the United States. The investment gain $ 252,000 return as well.

Next, we will determine how much will the treasurer get if he invest in Great Britain. First, we need to convert the investment into its value in pounds. The spot exchange rate is £ 0.791.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Investment in £} &= \text{Investment in \$}\times{\text{Spot Rate}}\\
&= \text{\$ 30,000,000}\times{\text{£ 0.791}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{£ 23,730,000}}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
The value of the investment in pounds is **£ 23,730,000**.

Now that we have determined the value of the investment in pounds, we will get the future value of the investment after three months. The computation is as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Investment in 3 months} &= \text{Investment}\times{\text{FV of Interest }}\\
&= \text{£ 23,730,000}\times{\text{$0.31\%^{\text{3 months}}$}}\\
&= \text{£ 23,730,000}\times{\text{1.0093}}\\
&=\boxed{\text{£ 23,950,689}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

The investment is worth **£ 23,950,689** after three months. We need to convert it back into U.S. dollars. Since the value is after three months, we will use the forward exchange rate. We will divide the investment by the forward exchange rate to get its equivalent value in dollars.
The investment is worth **$ 29,826,512** if the treasurer will invest in the Great Britain. The investment  will incur a loss of $ 173,488.

If the treasurer will invest in the United States, the investment is worth $ 30,252,000 after 3 months. On the other hand, if the treasurer will invest in Great Britain, the investment is worth $ 29,826,512 after 3 months. Therefore, the **investment is higher in United States after 3 months**.
As a conclusion, the treasurer will invest the company's funds in the **United States** since the return is higher and will incur a gain of $ 252,000.
